definitions: short poem expressing personal emotions typically meant to be sung
words of a song as distinguished from the music
examples: The ancient lyric captured the poet's deepest feelings
She wrote a beautiful lyric about lost love
Can you remember all the lyrics to that song
The lyrics perfectly match the melancholy melody

definitions: quality of expressing deep personal emotion in an imaginative and beautiful way through words or music
examples: The poet's lyricism brought tears to the audience
Her writing demonstrates a rare lyricism and emotional depth

definitions: person who writes the words for songs or musical compositions
examples: The famous lyricist collaborated with many renowned composers
She worked as a lyricist for Broadway musicals

definitions: short form of mackintosh meaning a waterproof raincoat
informal name for Apple Macintosh computer
examples: He grabbed his mac before heading out in the rain
Don't forget your mac because it looks like rain
She prefers working on a Mac rather than PC
The new Mac has impressive processing power

definitions: broken stone of uniform size used in building roads bound with tar or asphalt
examples: The old macadam road needs resurfacing after winter damage
They laid fresh macadam to create the new parking area

definitions: round hard-shelled nut from an Australian tree with rich buttery flavor
examples: She added chopped macadamias to the cookie dough
Macadamia nuts are expensive but worth the price

definitions: pasta in the form of short hollow tubes often used in dishes
examples: The children love macaroni and cheese for dinner
She boiled the macaroni until it was perfectly tender

definitions: large colorful parrot with long tail native to Central and South American rainforests
examples: The bright blue macaw perched on the jungle branch
Macaws can live for over fifty years in captivity

definitions: ornamental staff carried as symbol of authority in ceremonies
aromatic spice made from dried covering of nutmeg seed
heavy club with metal head used as weapon in medieval times
examples: The university president carried the ceremonial mace at graduation
The mayor's mace symbolizes the authority of the office
Add a pinch of mace to enhance the pie filling
Mace has a more delicate flavor than nutmeg
Knights wielded heavy maces to crush enemy armor
The museum displayed an ancient iron mace

definitions: broad heavy knife used as tool or weapon especially in tropical regions
examples: He used a machete to clear the overgrown jungle path
The farmer sharpened his machete before harvesting sugarcane

definitions: machines collectively especially those used in industrial production
organized system or structure for achieving something
examples: The factory installed new machinery to increase production
Heavy machinery was needed to clear the construction site
The machinery of government moves slowly but steadily
They need to understand the machinery of international diplomacy

definitions: person who operates machine tools to make or repair metal parts
examples: The skilled machinist crafted precision parts for aircraft
She trained as a machinist at the technical college

definitions: strong or exaggerated sense of traditional masculinity emphasizing physical courage dominance and aggression
examples: His machismo prevented him from admitting he needed help
The culture of machismo can be harmful to both genders

definitions: man who displays aggressive masculine pride and behavior
examples: He acts macho but is actually quite sensitive
The macho attitude doesn't impress everyone anymore

definitions: raincoat made from rubberized waterproof fabric
variety of red apple with white flesh popular for eating
examples: She wore her macintosh to stay dry in the storm
The old macintosh kept him warm and dry
Macintosh apples are perfect for making apple pie
He picked fresh macintosh apples from the orchard

definitions: informal shortened form of mackintosh meaning waterproof coat
slang term for pimp or person who controls prostitutes
examples: Grab your mack because the weather looks threatening
His old mack had seen better days
The street mack tried to recruit vulnerable women
Police arrested the mack during the vice operation

definitions: streamlined food fish with wavy markings found in temperate and tropical seas
examples: Fresh mackerel makes an excellent grilled dinner
The fishermen caught several mackerel before noon

definitions: raincoat made from rubberized cloth named after its Scottish inventor
examples: He put on his mackintosh before venturing into the rain
The mackintosh has been protecting people from rain since 1823

definitions: single instruction that expands into set of instructions to perform task
large-scale or overall view of something rather than details
examples: She created a macro to automate the repetitive data entry
The macro saves hours of manual formatting work
Let's look at the macro economic trends this quarter
From a macro perspective the project is progressing well

definitions: horizontal line placed over vowel to indicate it should be pronounced long
examples: The macron over the letter shows its long pronunciation
Japanese romaji uses macrons to indicate extended vowel sounds

definitions: polite form of address for woman equivalent to sir
woman who manages a brothel or house of prostitution
examples: Good morning madam how may I help you today
The letter began with Dear Madam as formal greeting
The madam was arrested during the police raid
She ran the establishment as a notorious madam

definitions: French title of respect for married woman equivalent to Mrs
examples: Madame Curie was a pioneering scientist in radioactivity
The waiter addressed her as Madame throughout dinner

definitions: person who acts in wild impulsive or reckless way
examples: The madcap raced through traffic without any caution
Her madcap schemes often got her into trouble

definitions: French title for unmarried woman or girl equivalent to Miss
examples: Mademoiselle Dubois teaches French at the local school
The letter was addressed to Mademoiselle Marie Laurent

definitions: place of uproar and confusion with no order
old term for psychiatric hospital or insane asylum
examples: The shopping mall was a complete madhouse during sales
Their house becomes a madhouse when all the kids visit
The old madhouse has been converted into apartments
Patients in the madhouse received terrible treatment

definitions: man who is mentally ill or insane
person who behaves in wild reckless or dangerous way
examples: The madman shouted nonsense on the street corner
They treated him like a madman for his beliefs
He drives like a madman on the highway
Only a madman would attempt such a dangerous stunt

definitions: educational institution for study of Islamic theology and religious law
examples: Students at the madrasa study the Quran daily
The ancient madrasa has educated scholars for centuries

definitions: alternative spelling of madrasa meaning Islamic religious school
examples: The madrasah provides both religious and secular education
Children attend madrasah to learn Arabic and Islamic studies

definitions: powerful whirlpool in sea or river that sucks in objects
situation of confused movement or violent turmoil
examples: Ships avoided the dangerous maelstrom near the rocky coast
The maelstrom pulled debris into its swirling center
She found herself in a maelstrom of conflicting emotions
The scandal created a political maelstrom

definitions: distinguished conductor or performer of classical music
master or expert in any art or activity
examples: The maestro raised his baton to begin the symphony
Young musicians competed to study with the famous maestro
He's a maestro in the kitchen creating amazing dishes
The design maestro transformed the entire building

definitions: organized international body of criminals originally from Sicily
group regarded as exerting hidden sinister influence
examples: The mafia controlled illegal activities in the city
Police worked for years to infiltrate the mafia
The literary mafia decides which books get published
There's a mafia of senior executives running things

definitions: member of the mafia organized crime syndicate
examples: The mafioso was known for his ruthless business tactics
Several mafiosos were arrested in the federal investigation

definitions: informal shortened form of magazine publication
examples: She flipped through the fashion mag at the salon
Pick up a mag to read during your flight

definitions: bright purplish-red color that is one of primary colors in printing
examples: The sunset turned the sky a brilliant magenta
She chose magenta ink for the wedding invitations

definitions: soft-bodied legless larva of fly found in decaying matter
examples: Maggots appeared in the garbage left outside too long
Fishermen use maggots as bait for catching fish

definitions: entertainer who performs tricks of illusion and sleight of hand
person with magical powers in stories and legends
examples: The magician pulled a rabbit from his top hat
Children gasped as the magician made coins disappear
The evil magician cast a spell on the kingdom
Ancient magicians were said to control the elements

definitions: office or position of magistrate or body of magistrates collectively
examples: She was appointed to the magistracy after years of legal practice
The magistracy handles minor criminal cases and civil disputes

definitions: civil officer who administers law especially minor cases
examples: The magistrate issued a warrant for the suspect's arrest
She appeared before the magistrate for the preliminary hearing

definitions: train using magnetic levitation to move without touching tracks
examples: The maglev train reaches speeds over 300 miles per hour
Japan's maglev technology leads the world

definitions: hot fluid rock material below earth's surface that forms igneous rock when cooled
examples: Magma erupted from the volcano creating new land
The magma chamber lies deep beneath the mountain

definitions: wealthy and influential person especially in business or industry
examples: The oil magnate donated millions to the university
Several media magnates competed to buy the newspaper

definitions: white tasteless substance of magnesium oxide used in medicine and industry
examples: Milk of magnesia helps relieve acid indigestion
The laboratory stored magnesia for various experiments

definitions: light silver-white metallic element that burns with brilliant white flame
examples: Magnesium supplements can help with muscle cramps
The alloy contains aluminum and magnesium for strength

definitions: piece of iron or steel that attracts iron and produces magnetic field
person or thing that powerfully attracts
examples: The magnet picked up all the metal paper clips
She used magnets to hang photos on the refrigerator
The new mall became a magnet for teenagers
His personality was a magnet for interesting people

definitions: physical phenomenon produced by motion of electric charge resulting in attractive forces
power to attract or charm people through personality
examples: Students learned about magnetism in their physics class
The compass works because of Earth's natural magnetism
Her magnetism drew people to her at every party
The candidate's personal magnetism won many voters

definitions: black magnetic mineral form of iron oxide important as iron ore
examples: Magnetite deposits were discovered in the mountain range
The geologist identified magnetite in the rock samples

definitions: process of making material magnetic or state of being magnetized
examples: The magnetization of iron requires exposure to magnetic fields
Scientists studied the magnetization patterns in ancient rocks
